author: Special Correspondent
text:
: With a view to raise awareness among the people, students in particular, about the importance of protecting the gift of vision, an unique painting competition was held jointly by the Child Development Committee of Rotary International District 3000 here on Thursday.

The event was organised in association with the St.John’s Vestry Anglo Indian Higher Secondary School and the Mahatma Eye Hospital.

Students from different schools participated in the event christened, ‘Kangal Irandaal,’ with their eyes folded with a piece of cloth. “It was a challenge but many students participated enthusiastically in it,” said Allirani Balani, Chairman of the Committee. The awareness programme on eye donation was also organised as part of the event.

The event was intended to create an awareness of the importance of good vision, she said and hoped that it was informative and guide students in protecting their eyes.

A. Jaya, Mayor, Kalaiarasi, Additional Chief Educational Officer (Sarva Siksha Abhiyan) and Grace Charlotte Thamburajan, Headmistress of St. John’s Vestry Anglo-Indian Higher Secondary School, spoke and appreciated the effort by the Committee.

K.S. Suganya, Ophthalmologist from Mahatma Eye Hospital, in a special lecture on ‘Eye care’, gave tips to the students on eye care. Eye care was essential for achieving good academic records, she said. A free eye-screening camp was also organised as part of the programme.
title: Unique painting competition conducted
